hero.p1: I'm Ryan - Catholic, husband, and Wiom's dev/data scientist building India's unlimited internet dream.
hero.p2: From the real world impact of Wiom's decision science engines to incessant aura-farming by sharpening my vim-first open source CLI/TUI stack, I love what I do.

projects.name: vixl
projects.catchLine: Spreadsheets for people who trust fingers over formulas. Pandas power, Vim precision.
features: Modal DataFrame grid with Vim navigation over Pandas + NumPy.
Explicit Python command bar keeps every transform audit-ready.
PyInstaller binary ships with self-update flag for frictionless installs.
projects.linkedTools: links with xyz for fast backlog CSV edits.

projects.name: gtkv
projects.catchLine: Vim's design meets graphics. Inline images without leaving the modal flow.
features: GTK4-first editor that keeps Vim muscle memory intact while enabling visuals.
Saves self-contained .gtkv.html files with base64-embedded images.
Native insert/save shortcuts so visual docs stay in the same workflow.
projects.linkedTools: pairs with o for selecting assets and vixl for data-driven notes.

projects.name: ai
projects.catchLine: Vim-first rewrite of OpenAI Codex running on the latest Responses API superset of Completions.
features: CLI + TUI modes wrap the Responses API so you can audit diffs, chat, or edit without leaving the keyboard.
Minimal, opinionated workflow trims noise and keeps every run focused on shipping the next concrete change.
Git safeguards stage changes for you and refuse to auto-commit, so the AI never hijacks version control.
projects.linkedTools: Streams reasoning inline while pairing cleanly with your terminal + Vim stack.

projects.name: o
projects.catchLine: File trees as living streams. Triage your filesystem at 120 FPS without leaving home row.
features: Matrix-mode columns freeze on focus so you never lose context.
Leader commands cover marks, yanks, renames, and bulk ops in one tap.
Configurable handlers pipe into Vim, Vixl, or your terminal stack.
projects.linkedTools: opens vixl and rt directly from directory view.

projects.name: xyz
bootLog: ready // log when x -> y so z
projects.catchLine: Outcome-first backlog OS. Log the job, not the busywork, and let compounding bets stack.
features: Agenda and month view with instant toggles and vim navigation.
Deterministic CLI (-x/-y/-z) for scripted backlog updates.
CSV-backed storage with $EDITOR integration for fast edits.
projects.linkedTools: exports tasks to vixl for deeper analysis.

projects.name: rt
projects.catchLine: Taste is muscle memory. Train your typing to ship code that actually sings.
features: Doc mode and typing drills sourced from intentionally structured Markdown.
Strict heading parser enforces real curricula, not AI slop.
Uploads lessons to Grok Collections for search and rote review.
projects.linkedTools: pairs with o for editing lessons in place.

projects.name: clipai
projects.catchLine: Clipboard-triggered AI macros. Copy ai{{...}}, get the answer before you leave home row.
features: Clipboard watcher swaps ai{{ prompt }} with OpenAI responses in real time.
CLI mode pipes answers straight into your buffer for scripts and automations.
Wayland-native service built on wl-clipboard with a systemd user unit for persistence.
projects.linkedTools: feeds vixl, o, rt, and xyz without breaking flow.

meta.label: > focus
meta.body: Productionalizing AI/ML models via agentic orchestration. Terminal-native product design.

meta.label: > experience
meta.body: 10+ years of polyglot experience across dev, data science, and intellectual property.

meta.label: > current_role
meta.body: Entrepreneur-in-Residence @ Wiom, building unlimited internet for India.

entries.headline: Married my beautiful wife
bullets: Married my wife – very beautiful indeed.
Relearned high-school math while shipping md2ltx, GitGuru, and DataSling.
Explored FP vs OOP, built DeathStarPilot, reaffirmed a vim-first workflow.
Rebuilt personal infra, consolidated automation, delivered Wiom's Genie engine.
Created rt and companion tutor apps to keep coding taste sharp.

entries.headline: Entrepreneurial rollercoaster to Wiom
bullets: Built LegalTech apps, burned savings, learned from a startup crash.
Joined Wiom's mission; shipped HAPPY and GENIE.
Deepened craft in Bash, PHP, Python, JS, and Gospel piano.
Explored Rust for a year before returning to Python's pragmatism.
Proved build-in-production with Python, JS, and SQLite for Wiom's internal CRM.

entries.headline: Law, code, and rediscovering craft
bullets: Rode out COVID disruption while practicing law.
Learned PHP; rekindled piano disciplines and builder mindset.

entries.headline: IP and tech attorney years
bullets: Worked as an IP and technology lawyer, observing how labor-driven businesses scale.

entries.headline: First LegalTech startup crash
bullets: Joined a LegalTech startup.
Ran email marketing campaigns; learned basic HTML.
Fell in love with the idea that computers can do whatever you tell them to—provided you ask nicely.

entries.headline: Law school foundations
bullets: Joined RMLNLU in Lucknow, grounding discipline in dialect and rhetoric.

entries.headline: Dropping out to chase better questions
bullets: Walked away from DU commerce to find deeper learning paths.

entries.headline: Challenging the script
bullets: Silent-quit CBSE science, refusing assembly-line thinking.

entries.headline: Dreaming in chords and code
bullets: Imagined life as a mad scientist, Liverpool midfielder, and pianist.

entries.headline: And so it began
bullets: Baptized Catholic.
